job_title: Divisional Director of Practice Improvement in Quincy, MA
pros: Supportive environment with smart people. This is a place I have had many opportunities to grow professionally and clinically. I have been here for more than a decade.
cons: For some clinicians there is a fee for service system but the agency is making more job salaried at his level and looking at ending this system.

review_title: Significant percentage of clients are high risk and/or low functioning.
job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Quincy, MA
pros: Committed staff and great group supervision.
cons: Because it's a CCBH, the paperwork is significant because of the state grants.

job_title: Therapeutic Mentor/Therapeutic Training & Support in Quincy, MA
pros: The clients and families are extremely resilient, and I learned a significant amount about what it means to work in the community with children and adolescents addressing mental health issues and building social and communication skills. I very much enjoyed the work itself and being with clients in a community setting. There is also a decent amount of control over your schedule. When the team culture was good, there were a lot of incredible clinicians to learn from and receive support from. There is so much to learn clinically, especially early on in your career!
cons: There is a high turnover rate that makes it difficult to maintain team morale and receive consistent supervision or provide consistent services. There is a sense that services are very much dictated by insurance requirements. Also the compensation and benefits did not at all reflect the intensity of the work.

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Braintree, MA
CERTIFIED PEER SPECIALIST in Braintree, MA
pros:
The CEO is really down to earth, loves to talk to all staff when he can.
Most people I have met in company truly care about others.
There is opportunity to really make a difference in the lives of clients
cons:
Pay is poor.
Doesn't feel like there's much room for advancement.
Very limited tuition reimbursement with no support above the Bachelors level
Depending on department, chronically understaffed, leaving high workloads.

job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Braintree, MA
pros: Great place to work, supervision, nice offices, supportive coworkers, good benefits.
cons: Burn out rate is high, some turn over but it has gotten better

job_title: Administrative Assistant in North Quincy, MA
pros: Wonderful people and a very friendly atmosphere.
cons: They pay you less than McDonald’s pays its employees.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Quincy, MA
cons: Poor management, low pay with no raises, rules change depending on the day. Staff is allowed to get away with extremely inappropriate behaviors

pros:

cons:

- Fee for service

The compensation is very small and hourly.

review_title: Good place work overall , friendly atmosphere
cons:
Low remuneration, Lack of diverse clinician

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Boston, MA
pros: Flexible work schedule and plenty of downtime to do homework
cons: Pay is low and no raises in over 5 yrs. Management only cares about filling in Quotas and not about staff safety

job_title: Residential Rehabilitation EDUCATOR in Quincy, MA
cons: there is a lot of driving

pros: A kind, compassionate work culture, opportunities to learn and grow, great work life balance
cons: No cons… This is one of the best places I’ve ever worked

review_title: Don't trust them and don't work for them
job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Quincy, MA
pros:
Some clinical supervisors are trying really hard to support the employees.
Great co-worker but it all got ruined by the dysfunctional higher management.
cons:
Dead-end job. It doesn't matter how good you are or how hard you work and you will be a slave forever because the higher management only cares about making more money and keep all the clinicians as slaves while they are making tons of money for their own pension. All they care about are how to squeeze the last blood from the employees while keeping advertising how much they care and love about their people in the community.

Don't trust any promise they made to you. Completely dishonest and money-seeking administrative team.

review_title: Workplace Culture That Is Caring, Encouraging, and Embraces Transparency
job_title: ACCS Recovery Specialist in Braintree, MA
pros:
Values employee work-life balance
Culture of openness and visibility around employee mental health
Relaxed, supportive, fun work environment
Use of language in the workplace, when discussing clients and mental health, is always humanizing, respectful, and sensitive. 
Management has confidence in employee competence and does not micromanage
Supervisors are knowledgeable, communicative, and supportive of employee development
cons: Healthcare coverage offered to employees is expensive

job_title: Mental Health Worker in Quincy, MA
pros:
-good clients 
-PTO and sick time 
-nice staff members
cons:
-very low pay 
-expensive healthcare
-when you leave for the day depends when the next person shows up and if they don't you can get stuck working a 16hr shift 
-expected to work holidays and during snow storms
